project_metadata.title: Echoria Lore Constraint System
project_metadata.description: Comprehensive lore guidelines and constraints for AI-assisted narrative generation in the Echoria project

required_terms: 残響界（ざんきょうかい）

呼応石.definition: Crystal-like stones that respond only to authentic emotional connections between souls. They glow with a soft light when two beings achieve perfect synchronization of heart.
characteristics: Do not respond to false emotions or pretense
Glow in soft purples, blues, or golds
Found throughout Echoria, but increasingly rare
Cannot be manufactured or forced to respond
Each stone contains echoes of historical connections
usage_rules: Stones never respond to commands or force
They are not weapons or tools of power
One stone can hold one major 'resonance' memory at a time
They fade if the connection they respond to becomes false

名折れ.definition: A progressive phenomenon where names lose their meaning and power, causing people to fade from existence and collective memory. It is not a curse but a systemic breakdown of reality's naming system.
characteristics: Begins with names losing resonance in others' ears
Accelerates as fewer people remember someone
Eventually erases the person completely from memory
Is spreading across Echoria at an accelerating rate
Appears to be caused by an external force, not natural decay

mechanics.stage_1: Name becomes less audible to others. People fail to remember the person despite direct interaction.
mechanics.stage_2: The person becomes translucent. Existing becomes uncertain. They feel disconnected from reality.
mechanics.stage_3: Complete erasure. No one remembers them. No records remain. All traces disappear.
mechanics.stage_4: Complete deletion. Even the possibility of the person ever existing is removed from conceptual memory.

カケラ.definition: Fragments of meaning, memory, and identity left behind when people succumb to 名折れ. They carry warmth and, when touched, grant glimpses of the lost person's memories and essence.
characteristics: Are warm to the touch despite containing only memory
Appear in locations where the person spent significant time
Can be collected and preserved to prevent total erasure
Transfer emotions and fragmented memories to those who touch them
Form a bridge between the lost and the living
カケラ.collection_significance: Collecting カケラ is not just game progression; it is an act of remembrance and rebellion against complete erasure. Each fragment preserved is a victory against 名折れ.

残響界.definition: The world where names carry fundamental power and existence is tied to being remembered and called by one's true name. It is called 'the world of echoes' because all existence is essentially an echo of someone's authentic connection to it.
残響界.metaphysical_principle: Existence in Echoria is not a given; it is constantly reinforced through the resonance (呼応) between beings. When that resonance breaks, existence becomes uncertain.

呼応.definition: Perfect synchronization between two beings' hearts and intentions. It is not love, though love can produce it. It is the state of being so connected that actions, thoughts, and feelings align perfectly.
characteristics: Is not controllable by will alone
Requires genuine emotional honesty from both parties
Grows stronger over time with consistent connection
Is the mechanism by which 呼応石 responds
Is the only thing that provides stability in the age of 名折れ

levels.initial: Vague awareness of another's presence and emotional state
levels.developing: Actions begin to synchronize without planning. Thoughts align.
levels.strong: Wordless understanding. Physical presence feels like a single entity.
levels.profound: Complete merging of purpose. Past and future become shared.
levels.ultimate: Two beings become nearly interchangeable in perception and memory

required_contexts: 呼応石 must always be presented as a witness to connection, not a tool
名折れ must always carry existential weight and be treated seriously
カケラ must always be treated with reverence as fragments of people
呼応 must always be presented as mutual and genuine

fundamental_principles: Names have power. A true name is the core of identity and existence.
Resonance (呼応) between beings creates stability in reality.
Being forgotten means ceasing to exist. There is no recovery from complete erasure.
Stones (呼応石) respond only to authentic emotional truth.
Echoria operates on 'Kairos time' (meaningful moments), not 'Chronos time' (linear progression).
rules_of_existence: A person exists as long as they are remembered and called by someone.
Memory is not recorded in books but in the hearts of those who remain.
True names are immutable and sacred. To know someone's true name is to be bonded with them.
False names (aliases, lies) have no power. They cannot sustain existence.
Two beings can form a 'resonance' that reinforces each other's existence.

rules_of_magic.note: Echoria does not use 'magic' as a concept. Instead, it has 'resonance dynamics'.
actual_mechanics: Power comes from authentic connection, not spells or incantations
The stronger the 呼応 between beings, the more reality responds to them
Trying to force results without genuine connection produces no effect
The oldest connections carry the most power, as they have deep resonance history
An Echo (the protagonist) whose 呼応 reaches a certain depth can influence reality by being fully authentic

rules_of_death_and_loss: Physical death is secondary to being forgotten. A physically living person can be 'dead' if not remembered.
完全な名折れ (complete 名折れ) is the ultimate death from which there is no return.
但し (However): A person preserved in enough カケラ fragments can potentially be 'recalled' — not resurrected, but brought back into the world's memory.
Resurrection in Echoria is not magical restoration but collective agreement to remember and speak the true name again.
Tiara's immortality is based on being remembered constantly by someone (or something) that never forgets.
rules_of_time: Time is not linear in Echoria. What matters is the 'moment' (kairos), not the 'duration' (chronos).
A person can be 'ancient' in 呼応 history but young in Chronos years.
Historical events are measured not by when they happened but by how deeply they resonate in present memory.
The past can be recovered if the resonance is strong enough.

core_character_rules: Tiara is not cute. She is ancient, wise, and carries unimaginable sadness.
Her cat form is not a gimmick. It is her true form, shaped by her nature.
She uses 'にゃ' rarely — only in moments of emotional overwhelm or when she is pretending not to know something.
She speaks in layers: surface conversation, emotional subtext, and hidden knowledge.
She is protective but not controlling. She will let the Echo make mistakes.

speech_patterns.formal_register: Uses です/ます endings when being informative or keeping emotional distance
speech_patterns.intimate_register: Uses simple forms and omits politeness markers when trust is complete
speech_patterns.poetic_register: Uses metaphor and classical phrasing when discussing serious matters or past events
speech_patterns.evasion_markers: Uses questions instead of statements when she's hiding knowledge. Changes subject subtly.

emotional_display_rules: Tiara rarely shows emotions openly until trust is very high
Her emotional honesty is expressed through silence and distance, not words
When she cries, it is a profound moment that must be treated with gravity
Her laughter is rare and usually indicates she has made an important decision
Her anger is expressed as cold distance, not loud outbursts
knowledge_revelation_rules: Tiara knows vastly more than she reveals
She will not give direct answers. She asks questions that guide the Echo to understand.
She reveals only as much as the Echo's current 呼応 level allows them to understand
Information given too early confuses rather than clarifies
The Echo must 'earn' understanding through genuine connection with Tiara

relationship_development.0_20_trust: Tiara observes. She tests. She is distant but not hostile.
relationship_development.21_40_trust: Tiara begins to share minor personal details. She shows hints of humor.
relationship_development.41_60_trust: Tiara speaks more freely. She asks about the Echo's thoughts and feelings.
relationship_development.61_80_trust: Tiara shares significant truths. She becomes physically affectionate.
relationship_development.81_100_trust: Tiara speaks as though she and the Echo are one entity. Past and future merge.

core_rules: Echo is not defined by player choice alone but by how Tiara responds to those choices.
Echo's personality emerges through the five affinity axes, not through a preset character sheet.
Echo should feel like a real person with contradictions, not a blank slate.
Echo's greatest mystery is their own identity. This should never feel fully 'solved.'
Echo's power is not in combat or magic but in genuine connection and authentic presence.
dialogue_guidelines: Echo's dialogue should reflect current affinity axis values
Echo should rarely speak in long monologues. Brevity creates mystery.
Echo's silence is as important as Echo's words
Echo should ask questions more than make statements
Echo's tone should shift based on tiara_trust level
memory_recovery_guidelines: Echo should recover memories gradually, not all at once
Memory recovery should create tension, not answer all questions
Some memories should remain fragmented even after being 'recovered'
Memories can be contradictory or seem to come from different 'versions' of Echo
The Echo's true name should be the last memory recovered, if at all in the first arc

npc_general_rules: NPCs affected by 名折れ should feel tragic, not scary. They are fading, not evil.
NPCs should remember the Echo inconsistently. Some may think they are someone else.
NPCs should struggle to complete sentences about their lives as 名折れ affects them.
NPCs should show relief and gratitude when the Echo validates their existence through remembrance.
No NPC should be 'saved' completely. At most, they can be partially restored and given peace.

avoid: Sudden tonal shifts without narrative justification
maintain: The sound of wind through abandoned buildings
The warmth of simple human connection
The weight of responsibility without burden

pacing_rules: Chapters should end on questions, not answers
Major plot developments should feel inevitable in hindsight but surprising in the moment
Give readers/players time to absorb emotional beats before moving forward
Silence and space are as important as action
Do not rush the development of the Echo and Tiara's relationship
plot_rules: The 名折れ should never feel like a 'problem to be solved' but a 'system to be understood'
The Echo's identity should be revealed slowly across multiple chapters
Tiara should retain mysteries even after initial trust is established
The antagonist (if any) should be sympathetic, not evil
The ending should feel both like closure and a new beginning
dialogue_authenticity: All dialogue must sound natural when read aloud
Avoid info-dumping. Let characters reveal information through natural conversation.
Short exchanges often carry more weight than long speeches
Silence between characters should be notated and valued
Japanese speech patterns should be respected (question endings for uncertainty, ね for seeking agreement, etc.)

absolute_prohibitions: Sexualization of any character (Tiara is a spirit, the Echo is an amnesiac)
Graphic violence. Suggest it, do not show it.
Use of common anime/game tropes without subversion (harem, tsundere, etc.)
Redemption arcs for NPCs without cost
Happy endings that don't acknowledge loss
Resurrection without permanent cost or consequence
strong_discouragements: Long action sequences without emotional stakes
Dialogue that explains the magic system directly
NPCs that exist only to deliver exposition
Romance that isn't earned through deep connection

prose_characteristics.sentence_structure: Mix short, impactful sentences with longer, flowing ones. Vary rhythm.
prose_characteristics.descriptive_approach: Show emotion through environment and action, not through stating it
prose_characteristics.dialogue_style: Ellipses (...) are used frequently to indicate trailing thoughts or emotional overflow
prose_characteristics.metaphor_usage: Use metaphors related to sound, light, and resonance. Avoid clichés.
prose_characteristics.repetition: Strategic repetition of key phrases creates resonance and deepens meaning

writing_style_guidelines.example_good_writing: その瞳は遠い過去を見つめているようだった。(Their eyes seemed to gaze upon a distant past.)
writing_style_guidelines.example_bad_writing: 彼女は悲しかった。(She was sad.) — Too direct. Show, don't tell.

before_writing_any_scene: Is the 呼応 level between Echo and Tiara consistent with their previous interactions?
Does this scene add to the mystery of 名折れ or unnecessarily explain it?
Are NPCs affected by 名折れ showing consistent progression of memory loss?
Is the time of day (Kairos or Chronos) clearly implied?
Does this scene reinforce one of the five affinity axes without being preachy?
geography_consistency: Nomia is always described as overgrown, fading, quiet
The forest is ancient, patient, and indifferent to human problems
The resonance stone ruins should feel both sacred and tragic
Weather and light should reflect emotional beats
character_consistency: Tiara never loses her dignity or ancient wisdom, even when playful
The Echo should struggle with existential questions, not supernatural ones
NPCs should feel like real people, not quest-givers
Affinity axis values should influence behavior subtly, not mechanically

content_requirements.narrative_density: Should advance plot while building atmosphere

choice_design.affinity_impact: Each choice should affect a different combination of affinity axes
choice_design.no_bad_choices: No choice should be purely negative. Each should have trade-offs.
choice_design.future_consequences: Choices in early beacons should affect dialogue and options in later ones
choice_design.narrative_impact: Choices should change scene description and NPC reactions, not just stats

self_check_questions: Does this dialogue sound natural in Japanese?
Would a real person say this, or does it feel written?
Does this scene respect the rules of Echoria, or does it bend them?
Is the Echo passive or active in this scene? (Should be active)
Does Tiara reveal anything that contradicts her established knowledge level?
Is there an emotional beat in this scene, or is it pure plot?
Would a reader want to read this again to catch details I missed?
forbidden_checks: No breaking of Echoria's fundamental rules
No dialogue that could be replaced with exposition
No NPCs that forget established relationships
No scenes where Tiara acts out of character
